block.p: Nancy Hui Liu, the daughter of Jane Young and Dr. Shili Liu of Mansfield, Conn., was married yesterday to Sergio Emilio Canales, a son of Teresa and Emilio Canales of Falls Church, Va. The Rev. James R. Covington, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at Sun West Studios, a photography studio in New York.
The bride and bridegroom met at Columbia University, where she graduated from Barnard College and he from Columbia College.

Nancy Hui Liu, the daughter of Jane Young and Dr. Shili Liu of Mansfield, Conn., was married yesterday to Sergio Emilio Canales, a son of Teresa and Emilio Canales of Falls Church, Va. The Rev. James R. Covington, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at Sun West Studios, a photography studio in New York.

Nancy Hui Liu, the daughter of Jane Young and Dr. Shili Liu of Mansfield, Conn., was married yesterday to Sergio Emilio Canales, a son of Teresa and Emilio Canales of Falls Church, Va. The Rev. James R. Covington, a Unitarian Universalist minister, officiated at Sun West Studios, a photography studio in New York.
The bride and bridegroom met at Columbia University, where she graduated from Barnard College and he from Columbia College.

Ms. Liu-Canales, 28, received an M.B.A. degree last Sunday, also from Columbia University. In July, she is to become a senior consultant in the New York office of Kurt Salmon Associates, a consulting company for the retail industry.
Mr. Canales, 30, is the technology associate at CBA Commercial, a company in Stamford, Conn., that specializes in commercial mortgages.
